intro: Androsace maxima var. longifrons, commonly known as the long-fruited rock moss, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows at high elevations. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
